Posts.Content: hi Whitby i had my hair cut to shoulder length before it started falling out then it got really painful so much it kept me awake so i buzzed it. couldn't stop rubbing the fuzz lol it still fell out but was so short it didn't feel as horrible as handfuls of the stuff.  i think it's a purely personal thing - if u can cope with the discomfort then u mite prefer to leave it as long as possible.  somebody else (sorry, i forget who) had enough round edges that they could wear a hat and still look like they had a full head of hair so they didn't buzz it. me, i missed my eyelashes way more than my hair on the other hand, no hair means amazingly quick showers good luck on the 12th
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: that is awful mariana. have u any family or friends that can help after the op?  if not i'm sure there are groups that can help u - someone will prob be along later that can give u more info on that.  i live alone with 2 cats but i have a sister that only lives bout 20 miles away, she comes to my appointments with me and that helps a lot.  going to stay with her for a few days after the op. i'm sorry you'r feeling like this at such a scary time. give macmillan a phone - they might know a local group that can arrange some help for you big hugs
Posts.Title: living alone with breast cancer

Posts.Content: i have a sister who works for a company that supports carers and the first thing they do is ask how they'r doing.  the trigger word is 'fine'  when people say that it rings alarm bells and they start gently digging to find out what the problem is. unfortunately the cancer team doesn't include someone who's only concerned with our mental and emotional wellbeing. it is really hard sometimes to admit how bad you feel when life still goes on and the people you mite talk to have other problems and you don't want to bother them etc etc i'v had a couple of meltdowns and the only people that know are on this forum (and the cats)
Posts.Title: Protecting others

Posts.Content: Hi all, i'm in the borders - getting anywhere is a pain especially after living in Central for years but weather permitting i'd love to be involved. once i'm in Edinburgh anywhere is easy
Posts.Title: 2019 Meet up in Scotland ? Anyone ?

Posts.Content: hi Jax68 congrats on getting thru the docetaxel FEC in some ways not as hard as docetaxel but unfortunately we'r all different so no way of knowing till u try.  Def take the anti-nausea tablets even if u feel u don't need them.  first week is usually the worst but then things start to improve and 3 week is almost normal.  i got tired a lot so learned to love naps - walking if u can does help. it doesn't affect ur taste buds the same way docetaxel does so that's a huge bonus and i found fruit smoothies in the morning kept things ticking along nicely ur almost there, fingers crossed u breeze thru this
Posts.Title: FEC

Posts.Content: this thread is so cool it's saved one of my friendships yesterday! no kidding - i really wanted to shred this woman then i realised she had said 'at least' and i cracked up laughing! it was one of those lucky you don't have kids conversations, i get lots of them and i usually agree but she added 'at least u just have cats'  to the mix what! those kitties give me furry cuddles when there's no-one else around! they'v been amazing and dam, i'v turned into that crazy cat lady  friendships intact altho i couldn't resist - spent 10 mins regaling her with cat antics, think she got the message lol thanks guys
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: i did get quite distressed when i lost my lashes - more than my hair but AnnJac's right - a bit heavier on the makeup and nobody notices.  i think most hospitals have a class that helps with makeup after hair loss, could be worth asking.  drawing eyebrows with none is a bit of a task, i got lucky - got a scar on one that helped lol and i'v gone 9 weeks after last dose not 6, but eyelashes started bout a week and a half ago - noticed cause they started poking me in the eye!
Posts.Title: Hair loss.

Posts.Content: Hi BugsFarm sorry but Fec-T does make u lose ur hair, sometimes some hangs on but generally speaking it's going to go.  u just mite need to get that hoover out check out the chemo thread - usually turns up as a topic there.  i lasted bout a week then it got too painful and i buzzed it off, had little bits that hung on in there but rest fell out, not quite so dramatic (or messy) once it was buzzed.  usually starts growing again once u get past the first half, Docetaxel doesn't seem to have same effect, altho i didn't realise this and kept buzzing the little bits lol the unfortunate bit bout Docetaxel is it goes for ur eyebrows and eyelashes but i'm 6 weeks past last dose and they'r making a reappearance yay! don't worry bout sounding flippant, anything goes here altho thot of ur dog chasing clumps of hair blowing on the wind made me laugh out loud - thank you!
Posts.Title: Hair loss.

Posts.Content: the weather here is really bizarre - it's sunny and mild! what on earth! this is scotland, it's supposed to be frosty and raining - just not normal!  but, took advantage and went for a lovely walk, bumped into a workmate who was out with her little girl and we went for a walk by the river. not having to bundle up made all the difference and the sunshine really lifted the mood. what a lovely start to the year
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: re: ali owl: i'm glad u did moan - i realised i have no idea when i'm supposed to start herceptin, gonna have to call and check on that one. 3 days after first chemo here and no serious SE's - couple naps and freezing, friends can't believe i'v got the central heating on lol
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: and yet another newbie to add to the list lol  Hi all start the chemo on 19th, depending on results of heart scan tomorrow, mite be beating a bit faster these days but think it's fine. didn't want to get my hair cut shorter till i read the leaflet suggesting getting a hair net for night - i'm really not up for waking up to a hairball of my own hair - yuck! so shorter it goes. def not going the cold cap route - couple mins with that on my head and they'l have to excavate to find a vein. am getting nervous - hence the babble, but keeping busy tomorrow to distract myself plus getting cat cuddles again - deflead and wormed them last week so they were a bit miffed. glad the doc suggested this site tho, been a great help
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: and yet another newbie to add to the list lol  Hi all start the chemo on 19th, depending on results of heart scan tomorrow, mite be beating a bit faster these days but think it's fine. didn't want to get my hair cut shorter till i read the leaflet suggesting getting a hair net for night - i'm really not up for waking up to a hairball of my own hair - yuck! so shorter it goes. def not going the cold cap route - couple mins with that on my head and they'l have to excavate to find a vein. am getting nervous - hence the babble, but keeping busy tomorrow to distract myself plus getting cat cuddles again - deflead and wormed them last week so they were a bit miffed. glad the doc suggested this site tho, been a great help
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: day 7 after first chemo and not doing to badly. tad depressed tho - i got a benefit check done to see if i could afford to take time off work and got a phone call this morning - no. i could if i didn't want to eat or travel or wash lol now i'm stressing - i work in a supermarket, 8 hours a day stacking shelves, getting banged about, cardboard cuts from disgustingly dirty boxes to say nothing bout the germs the customers bring in on a daily basis, esp with schools going back soon. but i really can't afford to take any time off at all. so worrying bout how i'l cope if i do get sick. also getting a bit stressed bout people's reaction when my hair starts falling out - seriously, some customers there have no personal boundaries and i don't want to talk about it to complete strangers. u guys are not strangers, ur fellow travellers anyway, think i'l make some soup and cheer myself up with some sopping crusty bread mmmm aww, kitty's timing is perfect - furry cuddles for me
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: thank you Ali Owl and Ms Jolly, u both just cheered me up. could work less hours, usually work overtime so will prob end up doing that, diff stuff to do while there is a bit harder - got plenty colleagues with back probs etc plan at min is to work as long as poss, curb the spending (cough cough - sniggers from sis) and save as much as poss for surgery cause then there won't be a choice. think i just panicked for a bit, going to go shopping (for fruit - i need it, honest!) and get some exercise cause it's cats nap time and they want a break lol  don't need to think bout it till monday cause i'm still on holiday :D thank you both for ur thots and that cat looks just like Fred - behaves like him too
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: wow! that was one powerful rain dance! had a thunderstorm last night - full works, torrential rain, thunder and lightning. confused the hell out the furballs - not frightened oddly but confused as to why they sky was flashing, kept me giggling lol  shame it only lasted 5 mins but what a sight!  hope it's a good morning all
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: playing with the cats this morning and had a random thot - they are due their booster shots half way thru my chemo so a question for all those cat lovers out there - can i take them myself or be around them afterwards or should i send my nephew and forgo the furry cuddles for a while?
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: hi Lilly012  the waiting is the scary part - have u got a date for the results?  sometimes helps if u know when it's coming. i went to GP with a lump i could feel, squishy and a bit painful so was hoping for the cyst result but mammogram found another lump next to it and one in my armpit - wasn't aware of either of those.  kind of a weird luck with the lymph node one as didn't have to wait, they told me right away that it was cancer. did have to wait to see if there were secondaries around and that was horrible. hate waiting at the best of times, throw in some stress bout cancer and bang goes sleep but the good news is it does pass and whatever the result is u'l then be able to work at fixing whatever the problem is got my fingers crossed for you and try and keep urself dirstracted big hugs
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Symptoms

Posts.Content: Hi again 7 - 10 days is a long time so keep popping on here - there's usually someone around if u need to talk, even a thread for the insomniacs so there's a good chance someone will be here even at 3 in the morning  i was diagnosed mid-june last year, just me and 2 cats and i'm 51 now so diff family situation to yourself - there are people with young children around if you want advice on what to tell them or call Macmillan. my sister lives close by tho and she's been coming to appointments with me which has helped. if u get called in, try to take someone with you - they can fill you in on anything you miss. the only thing i can suggest at the moment is don't keep your worries to yourself, they just spiral - talk and keep talking good luck
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Symptoms

Posts.Content: Hi Minty63 I'm sorry ur going thru this but glad u found ur way here the most important thing at the moment is 'Breathe' ur op got the tumour out with clear margins, the rest is mopping up in case there are any cancerous cells still floating around.  the 6 rounds of FEC-T is pretty usual, there's a great chemo thread here will loads of information about what to expect and support from others at various stages of chemo after chemo they like to wait 4 weeks - takes bout 3 weeks for ur body to process the chemo and ur immune system to recover, then another week for it to get even better so the wait is usual too.  Again, the 15 rounds of Radiotherapy is standard and they'l be throwing the booster in at the end cause ur cancer was grade 3 like u say, doing the chemo and RT is a personal choice, i said yes on the basis of throw everything they offer at it, i'm a big believer in every little bit helps lol   didn't have a PICC line inserted but loads of people here have and will be able to advise u on that and hopefully set ur mind at ease again, don't forget to breathe - ur a third of the way there big (gentle) hugs
Posts.Title: Breast cancer diagnosis and terrified of chemotherapy and radiotherapy...

Posts.Content: Hi Cazza1234 welcome - sorry to see you here but there's lots of lovely people here who will be able to help throughout this whole process. of course you feel lost  and looks like ur a bit stressed at min too - a 5 yr old and ur still awake at 12:45! so big, big hugs the waiting at the start and the not knowing how bad it is is awful but u will get thru it. concentrate on your daughter, find things to distract yourself and keep popping in here when u need to. there's a chemo thread here that i found really helpful.  you'r diagnosis is still new, so when ur imagining the worst try and imagine the best too - it can help with the stress for a while there's quite a few people with young children on the site so hopefully they'l be online and able to talk to you later in the meantime, more hugs and try and get some sleep
Posts.Title: Not sure what I’m doing

Posts.Content: altho a munro mite be a step too far at the min, later maybe.....
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hi Sunflower76  i live in the borders and ur post. made me laugh out loud  - i'v just had to shut the window cause my neighbour's lum is reeking! the smell of burning soot - yummy  Happy St. Andrew's Day
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: YES! get excited!  like the others have said, ur still stuffing the chemicals into ur body and it's hard to predict the reaction but.... ur body's doing well enuf to grow hair - that's a cause for celebration!  and if it does fall out again, u can deal with that when and if it happens but right now - u'v got stubble!   big hugs xx
Posts.Title: Hair returning - but should I get excited?

Posts.Content: Hi my last chemo was 1st Nov and same - very slow at first, think it was pausing to fill in the gaps but i buzzed it off last week.  it went so curly i struggled with scarfs - they were sticking to the hair as if it was velcro! got so frustrated i got rid of it now it's growing really fast and i have my fingers crossed it stays straight this time  met someone at radiotherapy tho who had a lot of hair and it had only been 6 weeks - she had at least 2 inches of hair!
Posts.Title: Hair returning - but should I get excited?
